attributes.action: Stop Closer Of Causewayend and Victoria Road primary schools in Aberdeen
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Education chiefs in Aberdeen have earmarked 12 primary schools and nurseries for closure or amalgamation.

After months of rumours, details of the council's radical plans for the future of city schools emerged begining of February

The information, contained in papers circulated to councillors ahead of a key meeting next month, reveals at least three primary schools have been identified for closure as part of the local authority's school estate strategy.



The draft report proposes the closure of Causewayend and Victoria Road primary schools within two years and Stoneywood Primary within five years.

Many others would be amalgamated, with some new schools to be constructed and others using existing buildings.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
